about.mission: I am a Senior Software Applications Engineer with a Master's in Computer Science. My journey includes impactful roles at Red Hat, Inc., North Carolina State University, and Tata Consultancy Services. Proficient in Full Stack and Systems-level Programming, I have excelled in implementing new features, conducting defect investigations, and deploying applications using varied technologies. Eager to contribute to cutting-edge projects, I am committed to elevating software engineering excellence in Software Engineering roles.

educational_qualification.courses: Artificial Intelligence, Parallel Architectures, Parallel Systems, Automated Learning and Data Analysis, Compiler Construction, Independent Study on Educational Systems, Advanced Machine Learning, Real Time/Embedded Systems and Machine Learning for Autonomous driving
projects: Achieved successful customizations and research projects on the open-source online courseware hosting platform OpenEdx. Measured impact through enhanced functionality and user satisfaction, implementing services across multiple servers, and establishing a Django-powered dashboard for efficient configuration management.

Accomplished the development of a Slack bot for classroom management, adhering to robust software engineering practices. Utilized DevOps tools such as Git, Travis CI, Docker, docker-compose, Makefiles, etc. Quantified success through streamlined communication and improved classroom efficiency.

Executed an in-depth analysis of transformer networks, CNNs, and word embeddings on the flickr9k dataset. Evaluated performance based on Bleu Score and Cosine similarity for caption prediction of images, contributing valuable insights to the field of image captioning.

Successfully conducted a comprehensive study on Multimodal Classification performance using Python TensorFlow, comparing it against Single mode classification on the Yelp dataset. Demonstrated the effectiveness of multimodal approaches over standard classification methods, emphasizing improved accuracy and classification results.

Demonstrated the efficiency gains of parallel processing using CUDA, OpenACC, OpenMP, and MPI in comparison to standard single-thread processing. Achieved optimization in algorithmic performance, with measured improvements in execution time and resource utilization.
